snippet: Profit declined 7.8 percent partly because of the health law and the high costs of a hepatitis C treatment.
abstract: UnitedHealth Group, federal health care law bellwether, reports first-quarter profit declined 7.8 percent partly because of the law and the high costs of a new drug to treat hepatitis C; earnings were $1.1 billion from $1.19 billion in year-ago quarter; revenue rose 4.5 percent to $31.71 billion.
lead_paragraph: Profit declined 7.8 percent partly because of the health law and the high costs of a hepatitis C treatment.

headline.main: Health Law Bellwether, UnitedHealth Posts Lower Profit
headline.print_headline: Health Law Bellwether, Insurer Posts Lower Profit

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
